did.abstract: The New Market Weather Notebook, 1902-1920, documents temperature and other weather information for New Market, Virginia.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the James Madison University Special Collections Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have been transferred to the James Madison University Special Collections Library. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library Reference Desk. (library-special@jmu.edu).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bookworm and Silverfish Bookdealers in September 1995.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Bookdealer Jim Presgraves identified this notebook as one of his purchases from an auction of Rupp family items in 1994. The Rupps were a New Market, Virginia family. "New Market VA" and "Rupp" are penciled in on the cover.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In order to streamline the process of applying collection numbers, Special Collections staff completed a large-scale renumbering campaign in the spring of 2017. This collection was previously cataloged as SC 3067.

bioghist.head: Bio/Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Rupp family lived in New Market, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The New Market Weather Notebook, 1902-1920, documents temperature and other weather information for New Market, Virginia. Temperatures and other weather details are recorded at irregular intervals from 1902 to 1920.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The notebook is housed in one folder.
